      • checkSession

        public java.lang.String checkSession(java.lang.String sessionid)
        Check if a session is active
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the sessionid if active, or "null" if not.

      • addNewUser

        public java.lang.String addNewUser(java.lang.String sessionid,
                          java.lang.String eid,
                          java.lang.String firstname,
                          java.lang.String lastname,
                          java.lang.String email,
                          java.lang.String type,
                          java.lang.String password)
                            throws AxisFault
        Create a new user account
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        eid - the login username (ie jsmith26) of the new user
        firstname - the new user's first name
        lastname - the new user's last name
        email - the new user's email address
        type - the type of account (ie registered, guest etc). Should either match one of the !user.template.XXX realms (where XXX is the type) or be blank to inherit the !user.template permission
        password - the password for the new user
        Returns:
        success or exception message
        Throws:
        AxisFault - This is the preferred method of adding user accounts whereby their internal ID is automatically assigned a UUID.

      • addNewUser

        public java.lang.String addNewUser(java.lang.String sessionid,
                          java.lang.String id,
                          java.lang.String eid,
                          java.lang.String firstname,
                          java.lang.String lastname,
                          java.lang.String email,
                          java.lang.String type,
                          java.lang.String password)
                            throws AxisFault
        Create a new user account
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        id - the id of the new user that will be used internally by Sakai
        eid - the login username (ie jsmith26) of the new user
        firstname - the new user's first name
        lastname - the new user's last name
        email - the new user's email address
        type - the type of account (ie registered, guest etc). Should either match one of the !user.template.XXX realms (where XXX is the type) or be blank to inherit the !user.template permission
        password - the password for the new user
        Returns:
        success or exception message
        Throws:
        AxisFault - This form of addUser() should only be used when you need control over the user's internal ID. Otherwise use the other form.

      • changeUserInfo

        public java.lang.String changeUserInfo(java.lang.String sessionid,
                              java.lang.String eid,
                              java.lang.String firstname,
                              java.lang.String lastname,
                              java.lang.String email,
                              java.lang.String type,
                              java.lang.String password)
                                throws AxisFault
        Edit a user's account details
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        eid - the login username (ie jsmith26) of the user you want to edit
        firstname - the updated firstname for the user
        lastname - the updated last name for the user
        email - the updated email address for the user
        type - the updated user type
        password - the updated password for the user
        Returns:
        success or exception message
        Throws:
        AxisFault - Note that if you only want to change individual properties of a user's account like their email address or password, see the related web services.

      • getUserEmail

        public java.lang.String getUserEmail(java.lang.String sessionid,
                            java.lang.String userid)
                              throws AxisFault
        Gets the email address for a given user Differs from original above as that one uses the session to get the email address hence you must know this in advance or be logged in to the web services with that user. This uses a userid as well so we could be logged in as admin and retrieve the email address for any user.
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        userid - the login username (ie jsmith26) of the user you want the email address for
        Returns:
        the email address for the user
        Throws:
        AxisFault

        public boolean addMemberToGroup(java.lang.String sessionid,
                       java.lang.String siteid,
                       java.lang.String groupid,
                       java.lang.String userid)
                         throws AxisFault
        Add member to specified worksite group
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        siteid - the id of the site that the group is in
        groupid - the id of the group you want to add the user to
        userid - the internal userid of the member to add

        AxisFault

      • addNewSite

        public java.lang.String addNewSite(java.lang.String sessionid,
                          java.lang.String siteid,
                          java.lang.String title,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          java.lang.String shortdesc,
                          java.lang.String iconurl,
                          java.lang.String infourl,
                          boolean joinable,
                          java.lang.String joinerrole,
                          boolean published,
                          boolean publicview,
                          java.lang.String skin,
                          java.lang.String type)
                            throws AxisFault
        Create a new site
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        siteid - the id of the new site (ie test123)
        title - the title of the new site
        description - the full description for the new site
        shortdesc - the short description for the new site
        iconurl - the url to an icon for the site (on the default skin should not be more than 100px wide)
        infourl - the url to a page of information about the site (this is added to the Site Information portlet)
        joinable - should this site be joinable?
        joinerrole - if joinable, the role to assign users that join this site
        published - should this site be made available to participants of the site now?
        publicview - should this site be shown on the public list of sites?
        skin - the id of the skin for this site, from the list in /library/skin/SKIN
        type - the type of site ie project, course, etc, or any type defined as !site.template.TYPE. If blank will inherit !site.template roles/permissions
        Returns:
        success or exception message Note that this will create an empty site with no tools. If you would like to create a site from a template, ie inherit its tool structure (not content), see copySite()
        Throws:
        AxisFault

      • removeSite

        public java.lang.String removeSite(java.lang.String sessionid,
                          java.lang.String siteid)
                            throws AxisFault
        Remove a site
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        siteid - the id of the site to remove
        Returns:
        success or exception message
        Throws:
        AxisFault

      • copySite

        public java.lang.String copySite(java.lang.String sessionid,
                        java.lang.String siteidtocopy,
                        java.lang.String newsiteid,
                        java.lang.String title,
                        java.lang.String description,
                        java.lang.String shortdesc,
                        java.lang.String iconurl,
                        java.lang.String infourl,
                        boolean joinable,
                        java.lang.String joinerrole,
                        boolean published,
                        boolean publicview,
                        java.lang.String skin,
                        java.lang.String type)
                          throws AxisFault
        Create a new site based on another site. This will copy its tool structure, but not its content
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        siteidtocopy - the id of the site to base this new site on
        siteid - the id of the new site (ie test123)
        title - the title of the new site
        description - the full description for the new site
        shortdesc - the short description for the new site
        iconurl - the url to an icon for the site (on the default skin should not be more than 100px wide)
        infourl - the url to a page of information about the site (this is added to the Site Information portlet)
        joinable - should this site be joinable?
        joinerrole - if joinable, the role to assign users that join this site
        published - should this site be made available to participants of the site now?
        publicview - should this site be shown on the public list of sites?
        skin - the id of the skin for this site, from the list in /library/skin/SKIN
        type - the type of site ie project, course, etc, or any type defined as !site.template.TYPE. If blank will inherit !site.template roles/permissions
        Returns:
        success or exception message
        Throws:
        AxisFault

      • addNewPageToSite

        public java.lang.String addNewPageToSite(java.lang.String sessionid,
                                java.lang.String siteid,
                                java.lang.String pagetitle,
                                int pagelayout)
                                  throws AxisFault
        Create a new page in a site. A page holds one or more tools and is shown in the main navigation section. You will still need to add tools to this page.
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        siteid - the id of the site to add the page to
        pagetitle - the title of the new page
        pagelayout - single or double column (0 or 1). Any other value will revert to 0.
        Returns:
        success or exception message
        Throws:
        AxisFault

      • changeSiteJoinable

        public java.lang.String changeSiteJoinable(java.lang.String sessionid,
                                  java.lang.String siteid,
                                  boolean joinable,
                                  java.lang.String joinerrole,
                                  boolean publicview)
                                    throws AxisFault
        Make a site joinable or not, depending on the params sent
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        siteid - the id of the site you want to change the status of
        joinable - boolean if its joinable or not
        joinerrole - the role that users who join the site will be given
        publicview - boolean if the site is to be public or not. if its joinable it should probably be public so people can find it, but if its public it doesnt necessarily need to be joinable.
        Returns:
        success or string containing error
        Throws:
        AxisFault

      • searchForUsers

        public java.lang.String searchForUsers(java.lang.String sessionid,
                              java.lang.String criteria,
                              int first,
                              int last)
                                throws AxisFault
        Search all the users that match this criteria in id or email, first or last name, returning a subset of records within the record range given (sorted by sort name). As of September 2008, the Sakai API that does the searching is not searching provided users nor limiting the returned results (ie first and last are ignored) This web service is returning everything it receives correctly though, so when userDirectoryService.searchUsers() is amended, this will be even more complete. See: SAK-6792 and SAK-14268 for the relevant JIRA tickets.
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        criteria - the search criteria.
        first - the first record position to return.
        last - the last record position to return.
        Returns:
        xml doc of list of records
        Throws:
        AxisFault

        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        authzgroupid - the id of the authzgroup, site or group you want to get the users in (if site: /site/SITEID, if group: /site/SITEID/group/GROUPID)
        authzgrouproles - the roles that you want to filter on (string with commas as delimiters)
        Returns:
        xml doc of the list of users, display name and roleid
        Throws:
        AxisFault - returns string if exception encountered and logs it

      • getUsersInAuthzGroup

        public java.lang.String getUsersInAuthzGroup(java.lang.String sessionid,
                                    java.lang.String authzgroupid)
                                      throws AxisFault
        Gets list of ALL users in an authzgroup
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        authzgroupid - the id of the authzgroup, site or group you want to get the users in (if site: /site/SITEID, if group: /site/SITEID/group/GROUPID)
        Returns:
        xml doc of the list of users, display name and roleid
        Throws:
        AxisFault - returns string if exception encountered

      • addNewToolToAllWorkspaces

        public java.lang.String addNewToolToAllWorkspaces(java.lang.String sessionid,
                                         java.lang.String toolid,
                                         java.lang.String pagetitle,
                                         java.lang.String tooltitle,
                                         int pagelayout,
                                         int position,
                                         boolean popup)
                                           throws AxisFault
        Adds a tool to all My Workspace sites
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session for the admin user
        toolid - the id of the tool you want to add (ie sakai.profile2)
        pagetitle - the title of the page shown in the site navigation
        tooltitle - the title of the tool shown in the main portlet
        pagelayout - single or double column (0 or 1). Any other value will revert to 0.
        position - integer specifying the position within other pages on the site (0 means top, for right at the bottom a large enough number, ie 99)
        popup - boolean for if it should be a popup window or not
        Returns:
        success or exception
        Throws:
        AxisFault - Sakai properties: #specify the list of users to ignore separated by a comma, no spaces. Defaults to 'admin,postmaster'. webservice.specialUsers=admin,postmaster

      • copyRole

        public java.lang.String copyRole(java.lang.String sessionid,
                        java.lang.String authzgroupid1,
                        java.lang.String authzgroupid2,
                        java.lang.String roleid,
                        java.lang.String description,
                        boolean removeBeforeSync)
                          throws AxisFault
        Copies a role from one authzgroup to another. Useful for mass population/synchronisation The sessionid argument must be a valid session for a super user ONLY otherwise it will fail. The authzgroup arguments for sites should start with /site/SITEID, likewise for site groups etc
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the sessionid of a valid session for the admin user
        authzgroupid1 - the authgroupid of the site you want to copy the role FROM
        authzgroupid2 - the authgroupid of the site you want to copy the role TO
        roleid - the id of the role you want to copy
        description - the description of the new role
        removeBeforeSync - if synchronising roles, whether or not to remove the functions from the target role before adding the set in. This will mean that no additional permissions will remain, if they already exist in that role
        Returns:
        success or AxisFault
        Throws:
        AxisFault - if not a super user, if new role cannot be created, if functions differ after the new role is made

      • copyRole

        public java.lang.String copyRole(java.lang.String sessionid,
                        java.lang.String authzgroupid1,
                        java.lang.String authzgroupid2,
                        java.lang.String roleid,
                        java.lang.String description)
                          throws AxisFault
        Copies a role from one authzgroup to another. Useful for mass population/synchronisation The sessionid argument must be a valid session for a super user ONLY otherwise it will fail. The authzgroup arguments for sites should start with /site/SITEID, likewise for site groups etc
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the sessionid of a valid session for the admin user
        authzgroupid1 - the authgroupid of the site you want to copy the role FROM
        authzgroupid2 - the authgroupid of the site you want to copy the role TO
        roleid - the id of the role you want to copy
        description - the description of the new role
        Returns:
        success or AxisFault
        Throws:
        AxisFault - if not a super user, if new role cannot be created, if functions differ after the new role is made

      • getSessionForUser

        public java.lang.String getSessionForUser(java.lang.String sessionid,
                                 java.lang.String eid,
                                 boolean wsonly)
                                   throws AxisFault
        Creates and returns the session ID for a given user. The sessionid argument must be a valid session for a super user ONLY otherwise it will fail. The userid argument must be the EID (ie jsmith) of a valid user. This new sessionid can then be used with getSitesUserCanAccess() to get the sites for the given user.
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the sessionid of a valid session for a super user
        eid - the eid of the user you want to create a session for
        wsonly - should the session created be tied to the web services only? the initial implementation of this will just set an attribute on the Session that identifies it as originating from the web services. but in essence it will be just like a normal session. However this attribute is used elsewhere for filtering for these web service sessions.
        Returns:
        the sessionid for the user specified
        Throws:
        AxisFault - if any data is missing, not super user, or session cannot be established

      • getSessionForUser

        public java.lang.String getSessionForUser(java.lang.String sessionid,
                                 java.lang.String eid)
                                   throws AxisFault
        Alternate (original) form of getSessionForUser that creates normal sessions for users.
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the sessionid of a valid session for a super user
        eid - the eid of the user you want to create a session for
        Returns:
        the sessionid for the user specified
        Throws:
        AxisFault - if any data is missing, not super user, or session cannot be established

      • addNewPageToSite

        public java.lang.String addNewPageToSite(java.lang.String sessionid,
                                java.lang.String siteid,
                                java.lang.String pagetitle,
                                int pagelayout,
                                int position,
                                boolean popup)
                                  throws AxisFault
        Create a new page in a site. A page holds one or more tools and is shown in the main navigation section. You will still need to add tools to this page.
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the id of a valid session
        siteid - the id of the site to add the page to
        pagetitle - the title of the new page
        pagelayout - single or double column (0 or 1). Any other value will revert to 0.
        position - and integer specifying the position within other pages on the site (0 means top, for right at the bottom a large enough number, ie 99)
        popup - boolean for if it should be a popup window or not
        Returns:
        success or exception message
        Throws:
        AxisFault

      • getUserId

        public java.lang.String getUserId(java.lang.String sessionid,
                         java.lang.String eid)
                           throws AxisFault
        Gets the user ID for a given eid.
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the sessionid of a valid session for a super user or the sessionid for the user making the request for their own user ID
        eid - the login username (ie jsmith26) of the user you want the user ID for
        Returns:
        the user ID (generally a UUID) for the user specified or an empty string ""
        Throws:
        AxisFault - if not a super user and the eid supplied does not match the eid of the session, if user does not exist

      • getUserId

        public java.lang.String getUserId(java.lang.String sessionid)
                           throws AxisFault
        Gets the user ID associated with the sessionid
        Parameters:
        sessionid - sessionid for a valid session.
        Returns:
        the user ID (generally a UUID) for the user associated with the given session, or an empty string ""
        Throws:
        AxisFault

      • getPagesAndToolsForSite

        public java.lang.String getPagesAndToolsForSite(java.lang.String sessionid,
                                       java.lang.String siteid)
                                         throws AxisFault
        Return XML document listing all pages and tools in those pages for a given site. The session id must be of a valid, active user in that site, or a super user, or it will throw an exception. If a page is hidden in a site, the page and all tools in that page will be skipped from the returned document, as they are in the portal. Super user's can request any site to retrieve the full list.
        Parameters:
        sessionid - the session id of a user in a site, or a super user
        siteid - the site to retrieve the information for
        Returns:
        xml or an empty list . The return XML format is below: Home sakai.iframe.site Site Information Display ... ... ...
        Throws:
        AxisFault - if not a super user and the user attached to the session is not in the site, if site does not exist

      • getPagesAndToolsForSite

        public java.lang.String getPagesAndToolsForSite(java.lang.String sessionid,
                                       java.lang.String userid,
                                       java.lang.String siteid)
                                         throws AxisFault
        Alternative method signature which will first get a session for the given user, and then get the list of pages & tools visible to that user in the site.
        Parameters:
        sessionid - must be a valid session for a superuser
        userid - eid, eg jsmith26
        siteid - site to get the list for.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        AxisFault
